world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Entity>
          • world.World
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Entity>, java.util.Collection<Entity>, java.util.List<Entity>, java.util.RandomAccess

    public class World
extends java.util.ArrayList<Entity>
    A class of worlds describing the game world of a game of Asteroids.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Tom Sydney Kerckhove & Xavier Goas Aguililla
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • evolve

        public void evolve(double dt,
          CollisionListener coll)
        Evolves the state of this world by a given time period and a collision detector. Also needs a collision listener to render explosions.
        Parameters:
        dt - The time difference over which to evolve this world.
        coll - The required collision listener.

      • isInWorld

        public boolean isInWorld(Position position)
        Returns whether the given position is within the boundaries of the world.
        Parameters:
        position - The given position
        Returns:
        | position.x <= this.x && position.x >= 0 && position.y <= this.y && position.y <= this.y

        Gets the number of entities in this world.
